{{stub}} '''Sound fonts''' are used by most [[software synthesizer]]s for [[MIDI]] playback. There are three main formats as far as [[ZDoom]] is concerned: * {{wp|DLS_format|DLS}}, or Downloadable Sounds, the standard backed by the {{wp|MIDI_Manufacturers_Association|MIDI Manufacturers Association}}. The [[TiMidity++]] synthesizer can use them. * {{wp|SoundFont|SF2}}, developed by {{wp|Creative_Technologies|Creative}}. The [[TiMidity++]] and [[FluidSynth]] synthesizers use them. * PAT, or instrument patches. (Technically not a sound font since they are separate files.) The [[TiMidity++]] synthesizer uses them. The choice of a sound font determines the quality of the MIDI playback.
==Forum threads== * {{forum|t=35219|"MIDI soundfont menu mod"}} - How to create a custom menu to quickly change which sound font to use. * {{forum|t=25901|"Music source"}} - discussion on everyone's favorite choice of [[software synthesizer]] and sound fonts. * {{forum|t=15459|"Best SoundFont for Doom?"}} - a similar, and larger, thread to the previous * {{forum|t=34176|"Recommend Me Some Great GM Sounfonts"}} - another such thread * {{forum|t=25409|"Weeds General MIDI SoundFont v3.0"}} - presenting a sound font created with Doom and other classic games in mind * {{forum|t=26822|"Cannot get .sf2 to work!"}} - might contain useful troubleshooting advice if you have the same problem as the thread starter
==External links== * [http://www.melodymachine.com/sfark.htm SKArk] - a utility to uncompress .sfark files into .sf2 files * [http://www.personalcopy.com/sfpack.htm SFPack] - a utility to uncompress .sfpack files into .sf2 files * [http://sourceforge.net/apps/trac/fluidsynth/wiki/SoundFont FluidSynth soundfont page] - contains many useful links * {{idgames|id=13928| |EAWPats}} - can be used with TiMidity++ to emulate a {{wp|Gravis_Ultrasound|Gravis Ultrasound}} * {{idgames|id=12527| |8MBGM and 8MBGSFX Gravis Patch Set v1.3}} - another set of GUS-emulating patches * {{idgames|id=17127| |GUS Patches}} - the actual deal, along with a few extras * [http://packages.debian.org/squeeze/fluid-soundfont-gm Debian Fluid R3 package page] - once extracted from the ".orig.tar.gz" archive, the SF2 files can be used on any system, not just on Debian
